descriptionHTML:
tinyCam Monitor is the best app for remote surveillance, control and digital video recording for your private or public network or IP cameras, video encoders and DVRs.

tinyCam Monitor FREE is the free, ad-supported version of tinyCam Monitor.


Features of tinyCam Monitor FREE edition:

- H.264 codec support for Foscam and Amcrest cameras.
- MPEG4/H264/H265 for many cams via RTSP protocol, e.g. Dahua, FDT, Hikvision, Huisun, Reolink, Sricam.
- ONVIF Profile S IoT devices support, e.g. cheap Chinese cameras.
- P2P support for some models w/ 20 characters UID.
- Support for MJPEG based devices of all major vendors, e.g. Axis, DLink.
- 2-way audio (talking and listening) demo mode (30 sec demo only).
- Control PTZ (Pan/Tilt/Zoom) enabled devices.
- Relay, LED control for some models.
- LAN scanner for automatic cams detection.
- SSL support (HTTPS protocol).
- 17 different layouts with unlimited number of cameras.
- Sequence mode for automatic cameras switching.
- Group cameras by tags.
- Import/export settings to local storage or cloud services.
- CPU/GPU efficient. HW accelerated video decoding.


Upgrade to tinyCam Monitor PRO to unlock:

- No ads.
- 24/7 MP4 video recording (Android 4.3+) to local storage/SD and JPEGs recording to the cloud (Dropbox, Google Drive, Microsoft OneDrive, Amazon Cloud Drive) and FTP/FTPS server.
- Video player w/ fast/slow archive playback.
- Time-lapse recording. https://goo.gl/FMCPUL
- Internal web server for remote archive access and live view.
- 2-way audio.
- Support for both in-app and on-camera motion detection (selective models).
- Front/rear Android camera support for use as an IP camera or dashcam. https://goo.gl/5z60mC
- Face detection.
- Audio real-time processing (squelch & alarm) for using it as a baby monitor with audio graph.
- Audio monitoring from multiple cameras at once.
- Melody playback via camera speaker. https://goo.gl/zsWC4z
- Background audio.
- Sensors support (e.g. temperature sensor, humidity, etc.).
- Google Cast™ Ready (Chromecast) support. https://goo.gl/g1d8yz
- Android Wear support. https://goo.gl/eZgaMt
- Widgets, floating windows. https://goo.gl/Eu0jZR
- Android TV interface w/ PiP support on Android TV 7.0+. http://goo.gl/MzZyoc
- Tasker plugin. https://goo.gl/lAvDdC


Check the list of supported manufacturers:
http://tinycammonitor.com/support.html


Want more public webcams? Install Worldscope Webcams free app for integration with tinyCam.
http://goo.gl/c4Ig2Z


Follow us:
Web: http://tinycammonitor.com
Facebook: http://facebook.com/tinycammonitor
YouTube: http://youtube.com/user/tinycammonitor
Twitter: @tinycammonitor
G+ Beta: http://goo.gl/mqBVlZ

Help the app to be translated!
http://crowdin.net/project/tinycammonitor


Permissions description:
http://goo.gl/bfz0WN


All company names and products are trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective companies.
comments: Tried this app but for me it is not very good. It has no support for my DVR's. It will connect but only show the first channel. Tried changing channels but does nothing. There is no DVR support at all e.g. remote playback, veiw logs or alarms, change DVR settings. My cams also have 2 streams a low bitrate as well as a high bitrate. When using my 4g data i would prefer to use the low bitrate steam as not to use to much data and keep the stream smooth, there is no option for this it will only connect to the high bitrate stream. I will have to keep using the XMEye app as this does have DVR support. This tinyCam app seems to be only good for connecting directly to IP cams only.

Allows you to bypass p2p & use your  static IP.  I like this app for the above fact. As the IP camera manufacturers p2p servers are all slow & unreliable.  With this app I can connect to my Tenvis IP camera via port forwarding  every time.  I would consider buying the pro version but that does not allow you to view or download video that's recorded on the remote camera.  I do not wish to record on to my phone via network as video is recorded, saved and overwritten on the remote camera.

so I wanted to connect for my other phone, but this app has like 5 cameras preset. why? noone downloads an ip camera watcher without having a can to watch or having an idea what he wants to watch. it works with the preset cameras good enough, no patience to delete them one by one(could not find out how)

I used to really rate this app. It was lean and did what it did really well and I had it for years. With the same cameras it won't display the feeds when you launch the app. I have to go into each camera by clicking edit and hit test. This clearly works and then brings up an image. I have to do that for minimum 1 but usually for both cameras which makes this a pain to use. I've now switched to OWLR which does what this used to do - display both cameras as soon as you open the app. If I use tinycam, the activity I want to see will have long gone which renders it pretty much useless. Giving 2 stars given the previous good history with this app.
Works ok but CONSTANT ads that keep on changing.  Nice that it works without needing admin permissions.  Did I mention there are CONSTANT ads, VERY irritating.  Too much to put up with.
It's to damn complicated to use this app... ðŸ‘Ž That's why I'm using ALFRED app. You just have to install two apps, and it's way easier to use...
